info.description: We are providing several API endpoints for external partners which are described in this documentation. All endpoints are using a REST-like interface, meaning they are called via HTTP with a specific payload (described separately for each endpoint, don't forget to set the Content-Type header accordingly) and respond with an application/json payload.
info.title: FIASCO AX Connector API

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Please provide the name and version of your application here.

200.description: The request has been accepted and will be processed asynchronously. The response contains the ID of the created calculation request.

400.description: One of the input parameters does not match the requirements. Details are provided in the response body.

401.description: Your credentials could not be authenticated.

403.description: You are not authorized to create new calculation requests.

500.description: An internal error has occured. Additional details might be provided in the response.

BearerToken.description: The access token (see [Token Generation](#Token%20Generation)) needs to be used to authenticate against our service (via the HTTP header "Authorization: Bearer $JWT").

username.description: The user name that was provided to you for signing in.

success.description: In case of an error this is set to `false`. Always available.

message.description: Describes the return status (e.g. error details). Can be null or empty.

example.message: Your token could not be authenticated

success.description: Either true (authentication was successful) of false (an error occured). Always available.

message.description: Describes the return status (e.g. error details). Can be null or empty.

accessToken.description: JWT that can be used to access other ressources. This token will have a relatively short lifespan (a few hours to a few days).

refreshToken.description: JWT that can be used to refresh to access token. This token's lifespan will be significantly longer (~ 200 days).
